body: compiler/turboshaft/machine-lowering-reducer-inl.h:REDUCE(ObjectIs) handles ObjectIsOp::Kind::kUndetectable by calling DependOnNoUndetectableObjectsProtector() (member helper DependOnNoUndetectableObjectsProtector() at bottom of file). If the protector dependency is present, it folds ObjectIs(Undetectable) into tagged-equals checks against undefined and null (is_undefined || is_null). The helper uses broker_->dependencies()->DependOnNoUndetectableObjectsProtector() to register the protector dependency (caches result in optional<bool> undetectable_objects_protector_). This is the Turboshaft lowering/assumption point that converts ObjectIsUndetectable to simple comparisons under the protector dependency.
explanation: Documents the exact spot in the turboshaft machine-lowering reducer where ObjectIsUndetectable is folded to simple comparisons when the NoUndetectableObjects protector dependency is recorded. Shows the dependency registration path through JSHeapBroker/CompilationDependencies.
